input_output.uvtable_filename: UVTable with data to be fit. (columns: u, v, Re(V), Im(V), weights)
input_output.save_dir: Directory in which output datafiles and figures are saved
input_output.save_profile_fit: Whether to save fitted brightness profile
input_output.save_vis_fit: Whether to save fitted visibility distribution
input_output.save_uvtables: Whether to save fitted and residual UV tables (these are reprojected)
input_output.iteration_diag: Whether to return diagnostics of the fit iteration

modify_data.cut_data: Whether to truncate the visibilities at a given maximum baseline prior to fitting
modify_data.cut_baseline: Maximum baseline at which visibilities are truncated

geometry.fit_geometry: Whether to fit for the source's geometry (on-sky projection)
geometry.known_geometry: Whether to manually specify a geometry (if False, geometry will be fit)
geometry.fit_phase_offset: Whether to fit for the phase center or just the inclination and position angle

hyperpriors.n: Number of collocation points used in the fit (suggested range 100 - 300)
hyperpriors.rout: Maximum disc radius in the fit (best to overestimate size of source). [arcsec]
hyperpriors.alpha: Order parameter for the power spectrum's inverse Gamma prior (suggested range 1.00 - 1.50)
hyperpriors.p0: Scale parameter for the power spectrum's inverse Gamma prior (suggested >0, <<1)
hyperpriors.wsmooth: Strength of smoothing applied to the power spectrum (suggested range 10^-4 - 10^-1)

plotting.quick_plot: Whether to make a figure showing the simplest plots of the fit
plotting.full_plot: Whether to make a figure more fully showing the fit and its diagnostics
plotting.dist: Distance to source, optionally used for plotting. [AU]
plotting.bin_widths: Bin widths in which to bin the observed visibilities. [\lambda]
plotting.force_style: Whether to use preconfigured matplotlib rcParams in generated figures
